reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lancaster Lodge was very nice -- nicer than it looks on the website -- having recently been renovated. Our rate included a nice breakfast, with fresh baked croissants. The hotel had soap, shower cap, shampoo, and our room had a view of St. Finbarr's Cathedral. In fact, it turned out that we were a very short walk from there. We got up very early the next morning and had time for a walk before breakfast. We were within walking distance of the downtown area, though lots of places were closed, as the day we were there was a bank holiday. We met my nephew and his family at Café de la Paix, which the hotel had suggested for lunch. It was quite pleasant, as we were seated in the sunny room, with a view of the river. We had a relaxed lunch there. Everyone seemed happy with their food, and the service was unhurried. We walked to town and spent a couple of hours in a cozy pub, The Old Oak on Oliver Plunkett Street. We enjoyed dinner at Rossini's Italian restaurant. However, I'm afraid I didn't do it justice -- I left half of it on my plate, as the servings were huge!
reviews.title: Good value hotel

likes.liked: — Very clean and comfortable with a view of St. Finnbarr's.
likes.disliked: — No problems with it at all

reviews.title: great value
reviews.text: Was in Cork for a family get together had never stayed at the Lancaster Lodge before but I have to say this is such a little gem. My wife and myself arrived on a Friday night and were delighted that the Lodge had such a generous Car park. The rooms are very smart spacious and extremely clean. In the morning we were very surprised my the extent of the breakfast and again this is the first time that we have been given a menu in which to order from and not the usual canteen approch that most hotels have. It is quite obvious that a lot of thought has gone into this hotel we will stay nowhere else when we are in Cork

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Lancaster Lodge for a 3 night special offer break from their web-site and was very impressed.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, Fab breakfast

likes.liked: — the breakfast, location, bedrooms, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were given a warm welcome and were efficiently checked in to our bedroom. Reception staff were very helpful in giving us recommendations and maps for the City.
reviews.title: bad mannered staff, cold food and noisy hotel

reviews.text: The room was very spacious and contemporary in design with all the mod cons. LCD tv with radio and on opening the wardrobe was very happy to see a hospitality tray with biscuits too! All too rare in hotels these days! The bed was very comfortable with lovely white linen and duvet.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Very Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would caution anyone booking through the Lancaster Lodge's own website to be careful. The website rather cleverly (and ever so slightly misleadingly) describes the Lodge as "4 star boutique accommodation", reflecting the fact that this is a 4* guesthouse rather than a hotel. Anyone looking for a luxury "boutique hotel" experience should look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Nice accommodation, but not 4* hotel

reviews.text: That said, the Lancaster Lodge is a very nice guesthouse in a very central location in Cork. It is good value for money (we paid €99p/n for room-only), the rooms are comfortable and the staff are quite pleasant and helpful. But boutique hotel it ain't.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights and this was the nicest hotel during our 12 day jaunt through Ireland. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and very modern. We did leave the windows open all night and at times some guests in the parking lot were very loud. Also a bright security light shined directly in the window, so in order the sleep in darkness, the window shades had to be drawn closed, which cut down on the air circulation. Overall a great stay and a short walk to city center Cork. We found shopping and food to be nearby.
reviews.title: good hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for three nights with my husband at the end of June. The hotel did not look very impressive from the outside but it was much better inside. The room was clean and spacious with a bath & shower. The bed was comfortable. The only downside was no air con so the room got very hot and sleeping with the window open was made difficult because of the traffic outside.
reviews.title: Great stay -Comfortable bed & wonderful breakfasts.
Lancaster Lodge Cork
reviews.text: Breakfast was good, a choice of hot breakfasts and a buffet aswell.

Stayed for two nights earlier this week during a brief tour of Cork & Kerry. Room was spacious, clean & comfortable. Good breakfast. Very helpful staff - especially the night porter who arranged an early breakfast for us (6.30 am) prior to an early flight home.
reviews.title: Nice accommodation

likes.liked: — Clean & spacious rooms, off street parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: arrived after spending 5 nights in Grove house, SW cork - very god. wanted to stay 2 nights city so found this hotel on internet with fair price. decided upon arrival to upgrade to jacuzzi suite - big mistake, although i got a discount for upgrading?!
reviews.title: very nice - but.......

likes.disliked: — lack of luxury for a suite

reviews.text: So extra 60Euro and what did we get ? a small bath with a few jets in it, hardly a jacuzzi i was expecting, the room was nice and clean, but nothing fancy, in fact a travel lodge would have been similar - which i wished i had booked, due to the cost,
reviews.title: Irish Gem

likes.liked: — clean and comfortable value for money

reviews.text: the breafast was very good and was clean and tidy the hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I complained to the front desk, but didnt get any help, most were polih and didnt understand me.
reviews.title: Nice - but not boutique.

likes.liked: — Close proximity to centre of Cork

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Lancaster Lodge for two nights in October. This hotel was located in a really great location with less than a 10 minute walk to city center and Oliver Plunkett street where there are great shops, pubs and restaurants. What I did not like about this hotel is the room we had was small and had sloping ceilings which made it seem even more cramped. I especially did not like the bathroom which had a tiny stand-up shower that you could barely move in and no counter space to put your stuff on. We were in a room in the back of the hotel and there was a huge construction project going on right behind the hotel. We were woken up both mornings by the construction noise which started around 7 am. Breakfast was very good with many choices for a hot breakfast that you could order from the menu in addition to a cold buffet. I do have to say that the staff at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful and gave us wonderful suggestions for dinner. There is also a free car park at this hotel.
reviews.title: My least favorite hotel in Ireland

likes.disliked: — Room and bathroom was small and cramped

reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel, the rooms was very spacious and comfortable.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: The bathroom is nice too and the shower was so powerful, which is what I like in a hotel.
reviews.title: Everything you really need at the Lancaster Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: just about a 3 star...

likes.liked: — Quiet location yet near to city.

reviews.text: FYI We didn't have breakfast there as we have made alternate plans.
reviews.title: Okie but not great!

likes.disliked: — Noisy disruptive shower.(heard within 3 rooms away)
